io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol

Class AnsonMsg<T extends AnsonBody>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.odysz.anson.Anson
      • io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol.AnsonMsg<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.odysz.anson.IJsonable

    public class AnsonMsg<T extends AnsonBody>
extends io.odysz.anson.Anson

    Base class of message used by serv11.

    1. A incoming json message is parsed by *.serv into JMessage, which can be used to directly to build statements;
    2. An outgoing data object which is presented as AnsonMsg<AnsonResp>, which should been directly write into output stream.
    Author:
    odys-z@github.com

      Client must use enum name, e.g.

      void port(String pport) 
      int seq() 
      static void understandPorts(IPort p)
      Set the default IPort implelemtation, which is used for parsing port name (string) to IPort instance, like AnsonMsg.Port.
      Because {AnsonMsg.Port only defined limited ports, user must initialize JMessage with understandPorts(IPort).
      An example of how to use this is shown in jserv-sample/io.odysz.jsample.SysMenu.
      Also check how to implement IPort extending AnsonMsg.Port, see example of jserv-sample/io.odysz.jsample.protocol.Samport.

      • Methods inherited from class io.odysz.anson.Anson

        fromBlock, fromJson, fromJson, toBlock, toJson, toMapBlock, toString, unescape

      • understandPorts

        public static void understandPorts(IPort p)
        Set the default IPort implelemtation, which is used for parsing port name (string) to IPort instance, like AnsonMsg.Port.
        Because {AnsonMsg.Port only defined limited ports, user must initialize JMessage with understandPorts(IPort).
        An example of how to use this is shown in jserv-sample/io.odysz.jsample.SysMenu.
        Also check how to implement IPort extending AnsonMsg.Port, see example of jserv-sample/io.odysz.jsample.protocol.Samport.
        Parameters:
        p - extended Port
